stories.story: As a recruiter I want a clear hero and CTA so I can quickly evaluate the candidate
stories.acceptance:
Given a user visits the homepage
When the page loads
Then hero, summary, featured projects and resume CTA are visible

stories.story: As a recruiter I want featured projects on the homepage so I can spot relevant work
stories.acceptance:
Given a user scrolls to featured projects
When project cards render
Then each card shows title, short description, tech tags, and link to detail

stories.story: As a visitor I want mobile responsive layout so I can view on my phone
stories.acceptance:
Given a user on mobile
When they view homepage
Then layout adapts and touch areas are accessible

stories.story: As a technical lead I want project detail pages with technical notes so I can evaluate architecture
stories.acceptance:
Given a user views project detail
When details load
Then project shows description, tech stack, impact, links to GitHub

stories.story: As a developer I want code links to GitHub so I can review implementations
stories.acceptance:
Given a user clicks GitHub link
When link opens
Then repository page loads in new tab

stories.story: As a recruiter I want to ask questions about skills so I can assess fit
stories.acceptance:
Given a user asks about skills
When AI processes KB-contained question
Then assistant returns accurate answer

stories.story: As a recruiter I want example questions so I can quickly try the assistant
stories.acceptance:
Given a user visits /ai-agency
When page loads
Then example questions are visible and clickable

stories.story: As a product owner I want rate limiting to control cost
stories.acceptance:
Given excessive requests
When rate limit exceeded
Then API returns 429 and guidance

stories.story: As a recruiter I want to contact the candidate via form
stories.acceptance:
Given a user fills contact form
When submitted
Then backend sends email and returns 200

stories.story: As an admin I want honeypot anti-spam to reduce spam messages
stories.acceptance:
Given a bot fills honeypot
When form submitted
Then backend ignores and returns 200

stories.story: As an admin I want to edit project content without coding
stories.acceptance:
Given admin accesses CMS
When they edit content
Then updates reflect on site

stories.story: As a product owner I want privacy-aware analytics so I can monitor traffic
stories.acceptance:
Given analytics present
When dashboards viewed
Then show unique visitors, conversions, popular pages

stories.story: As a site owner I want WCAG AA compliance so the site is accessible
stories.acceptance:
Given accessibility audit
When tests run
Then core flows meet WCAG AA

stories.story: As a devops engineer I want CI/CD to run builds and deploy
stories.acceptance:
Given changes pushed to main
When CI runs
Then build, tests and deploy succeed
